result.value:
# Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

In the interest of fostering an open and welcoming environment, we as
contributors and maintainers pledge to making participation in our project and
our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body
size, disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression,
level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal
appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that contributes to creating a positive environment
include:

* Using welcoming and inclusive language
* Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
* Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
* Focusing on what is best for the community
* Showing empathy towards other community members

Examples of unacceptable behavior by participants include:

* The use of sexualized language or imagery and unwelcome sexual attention or
 advances
* Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
* Public or private harassment
* Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or electronic
 address, without explicit permission
* Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a
 professional setting

## Our Responsibilities

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying the standards of acceptable
behavior and are expected to take appropriate and fair corrective action in
response to any instances of unacceptable behavior.

Project maintainers have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or
reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions
that are not aligned to this Code of Conduct, or to ban temporarily or
permanently any contributor for other behaviors that they deem inappropriate,
threatening, offensive, or harmful.

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies both within project spaces and in public spaces
when an individual is representing the project or its community. Examples of
representing a project or community include using an official project e-mail
address, posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed
representative at an online or offline event. Representation of a project may be
further defined and clarified by project maintainers.

## Enforcement

Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be
reported by contacting the project team at lidaof@gmail.com. All
complaints will be reviewed and investigated and will result in a response that
is deemed necessary and appropriate to the circumstances. The project team is
obligated to maintain confidentiality with regard to the reporter of an incident.
Further details of specific enforcement policies may be posted separately.

Project maintainers who do not follow or enforce the Code of Conduct in good
faith may face temporary or permanent repercussions as determined by other
members of the project's leadership.

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant][homepage], version 1.4,
available at https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4/code-of-conduct.html

[homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org

For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see
https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq

result.original_header: Embedding the browser in any HTML file
result.value:
The key API is the function `renderBrowserInElement`, it accepts the `contents` array as first argument,
and `container` as second argument which is a DOM element.
Please check all the documentation at [https://eg.rtfd.io/](https://eg.rtfd.io/).
Yes please! Feature requests / pull requests are welcome.

result.original_header: Embedding the browser in any HTML file
result.value:
Create a HTML page with following contents: (the example shows how to embed a mouse browser with 2 bigWig tracks from ENCODE data portal and 1 from our own server) ```html WashU Epigenome Browser

Embedding test

some other headings

```

result.description:
-   3D viewer can enable region set view from segments
-  fixes a bug in qBed track horizontal value can only be integer numbers
-  fixes the TrackRegionController region parse error

## What's Changed
* Bump handlebars from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3 in /backend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/143
* sea hare aplCal3 genome ready by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/145
* Calling card track update by @arnavm in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/147
* Support multiple genome align display by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/118
* Changed calling card STRING field to ANNOTATION by @arnavm in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/148
* add spotted gar genome with comparison with zebrafish by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/149
* Added text track support for callingcard by @arnavm in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/151
* Renamed CallingCard to QBed by @arnavm in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/158
* Bump mongodb from 3.0.2 to 3.1.13 in /backend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/175
* Bump lodash from 4.17.14 to 4.17.19 in /backend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/165
* chimpanzee panTro6 genome by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/178
* Primates by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/185
* Bump axios from 0.19.2 to 0.21.1 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/186
* Dynamic Sequence Tracks by @suragnair in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/192
* Several improvements dealing secondary genomes by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/197
* Bump lodash from 4.17.20 to 4.17.21 in /backend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/196
* Bump handlebars from 4.7.6 to 4.7.7 in /backend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/195
* Bump three from 0.110.0 to 0.125.0 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/193
* add hg19-primate alignments by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/199
* Bump codemirror from 5.58.1 to 5.58.2 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/202
* Bump lodash from 4.17.20 to 4.17.21 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/203
* all human mouse alignments by @samuelchen2004 in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/206
* Changed Genome Picker by @lambdasc in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/207
* Chromosomepickererror by @lambdasc in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/208
* Bump axios from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/209
* Bump underscore from 1.11.0 to 1.12.1 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/210
* Add omicron as default by @ChangxuFan in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/223
* Bump lodash from 4.17.20 to 4.17.21 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/227
* Bump codemirror from 5.58.1 to 5.58.2 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/226
* Bump axios from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/225
* Bump underscore from 1.11.0 to 1.12.1 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/224
* Bump ws from 5.2.2 to 5.2.3 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/232
* Bump three from 0.125.2 to 0.137.0 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/231
* Bump node-fetch from 2.6.1 to 2.6.7 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/230
* Update genome switcher. Change icon. Genome picker bug fix. by @lambdasc in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/234
* imported uniprot annotation from ucsc by @ChangxuFan in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/236
* Alignment track changes by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/237
* Bump ua-parser-js from 0.7.22 to 0.7.31 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/238
* Bump node-sass from 6.0.1 to 7.0.0 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/239
* Bump follow-redirects from 1.14.6 to 1.14.8 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/240
* Alignment enhancement by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/242
* cleanup curve alignment blocks by @xzhuo in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/243
* Bump url-parse from 1.4.7 to 1.5.7 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/244
* Bump url-parse from 1.5.7 to 1.5.10 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/246
* Bump diff from 1.0.4 to 3.5.0 in /frontend by @dependabot in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/249

## New Contributors
* @arnavm made their first contribution in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/147
* @suragnair made their first contribution in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/192
* @samuelchen2004 made their first contribution in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/206
* @lambdasc made their first contribution in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/207
* @ChangxuFan made their first contribution in https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/pull/223

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/compare/v50.0.0...v53.6.2

-   this release is not an update for browser function but related to dependent package
-   updated to use `webpack` 4 and `typescript` 3.4
-   removed deprecated package `react-scripts-ts`, use typescript support from `create-react-app`
-   updated `react-app-rewired` to 2.1
-   motivated by [an issue](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/16211) that ArcDisplay is not working on build version but development version

-   track height and color configuration enabled for genome align track
-   tooltip on heatmap and heatmap style of interaction track
-   annotation tracks adding UI will be shown when corresponding genome align track is added
-   fixed a bug that intra-region arcs are not displayed
-   fixed an [Unable to preventDefault inside passive event listener](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/6436) bug
-   fixed the bug highlight region error when genomealign track is added, related to [#104](https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react/issues/104)
-   fixed an issue that tracks order in local hub doesn't follow order in `hub.config.json` file
-   local track supports BAM track now
-   fixed a bug that categorical track error when category not exists in hub file

-   genome alignment track enhanced view, improved by Xiaoyu Zhuo
-   allow users to upload local file as tracks
-   allow users to upload entire folder or many files as a data hub by creating a `hub.config.json` file
-   HiC track normalization implemented by Silas Hsu

-   first stable version since we start coding the new version of the browser code
-   embedding browser function is available
-   browser code also uploaded to npm
-   (version number prior to 47 refers to the old browser codebase)

result.value:
Install [Node](https://nodejs.org/en/). Download the source code from our [github repo](https://github.com/lidaof/eg-react).

1. Enter the `frontend` directory
2. `npm install` (try `npm install --force` if getting error)
3. `npm start`

Your local browser is available at [localhost:3000/browser](http://localhost:3000/browser/).
Enter the `backend` directory. `npm install`, and then `npm run setup`. MongoDB must be installed and running.
